venue.name: Morse Recital Hall in Sprague Memorial Hall

item.description:
Part of Yale School of Music's concert series, this piano concert looked particularly good, with some rare pieces being performed. If you haven't been to a concert in Morse Hall, you should come join us for this event. Morse is a beautiful hall, fairly recently renovated, and it's a great place to hear live music performed by some very talented folks. And the price is right - free!

We'll meet in the main lobby of Morse Hall at about 7:45, which is inside of Sprague Hall on College Street between Wall & Elm. We'll head in about 5 of 8:00 to get seats - they shut the doors pretty promptly at showtime and don't let anyone in, so unfortunately there's no way to squeak in if you're running late.

Here are the details about the concert from Yale's website:

1 & 2 Pianos, 4 & 6 Hands
Special Event

Music for one and two pianos, four and six hands. This striking program features rarely-heard works for piano six hands alongside music for two pianos and piano four hands. Mozart: Overture to The Marriage of Figaro for piano six hands; Andante and Five Variations in G major, K. 501, for piano four hands; Sonata for Two Pianos in D major, K . 448. Schnittke: Homage to Stravinsky, Prokofivev, and Shostakovich for piano six hands. Stravinsky: The Rite of Spring for piano four hands. This New Haven concert is a free preview of Yale in New York's Feb. 7 program.

Contact for this event is: Ed
Contact number: 203-583-9668 (give me a call on my cellphone if you are looking for us in the lobby, I'll try to be there by 7:30 or so)
item.name: Concert at Yale's Morse Recital Hall: 1 & 2 Pianos, 4 & 6 Hands
